params.txHash: Tx hash (redemption id) of the redemption transfer

params.redemptionId: The redemption Id for a given redemption                           request

params.wrappedRwaAmountIn: The amount of wrapped rwa to convert to rwa

params.depositAmountAfterFee: The amount of the deposit after fees
params.feeAmount: The amount of the fees taken
params.txHash: The transaction hash of the deposit
params.user: The address of the user who made the deposit

params.timestamp: The timestamp of the redemption request
params.txHash: The tx hash (redemption Id) of the redemption
params.user: The address of the user who made the redemption

claimMint(bytes32[]).details: Implicitly does all transfer checks present in underlying `rwa`The priceId corresponding to a given depositId must be set prior to      claiming a mint

params.depositIds: An array containing the deposit Ids one wishes to claim

claimRedemption(bytes32[]).details: Implicitly does all checks present in underlying `rwa`The price Id corresponding to a redemptionId must be set prior to      claiming a redemption

params.redemptionIds: an Array of redemption Id's which ought to fulfilled

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

instantMint(uint256).details: All fees are deducted from amount transferred by      `instantMintAssetManager`

instantRedemption(uint256).details: All fees are deducted from collateral transferred by      `instantMintAssetManager`

params.depositAmountAfterFee: The deposit value for the new entry
params.depositIdToOverwrite: The depositId of the entry we wish to                              overwrite
params.priceId: The priceId to be associated with the new                              entry
params.user: The user for the new entry

params.priceId: The priceID to be associated with the new                                entry
params.redemptionIdToOverwrite: The redemptionId of the entry we wish to                                overwrite
params.rwaTokenAmountBurned: The burn amount for the new entry
params.user: The user for the new entry

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

params.amount: The amount (in units of `rwa`) that a user wishes to redeem               from the fund

params.offChainDestination: A hash of the destination to which                               the request should be serviced to.

params.amount: The amount of wrapped rwa that the user would like to burn
The amount of collateral one wished to deposit

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._instantMintFee: new mint fee specified in basis points

params.newMintLimit: New limit that dictates how much RWA can be minted                     in a specified duration                     (in 18 decimals per the RWA contract)

params.newMintLimitDuration: New limit that specifies the interval                             (in seconds) in which only mintLimit RWA                             can be minted within

params._instantRedemptionFee: new redemption fee specified in basis points

params.newRedemptionLimit: New limit that dicates how much RWA                       can be redeemed in a specified duration                       (in 18 decimals per the RWA contract)

params.newRedemptionLimitDuration: New limit that specifies the interval                               (in seconds) in which only RedemptionLimit RWA                               can be redeemed within

params.minDepositAmount: The minimum amount required to submit a deposit                         request

params._minimumRedemptionAmount: The minimum amount required to submit a                                 redemption request

setMintFee(uint256).details: The maximum fee that can be set is 10_000 bps, or 100%

params._mintFee: The new mint fee specified in basis points

params._minimumOffChainRedemptionAmount: The new minimum off chain                                         redemption amount

params.depositIds: an Array of deposit Ids to be associated
params.priceIds: an Array of price Ids to be associated
an Array of priceIds to associate
params.redemptionIds: an Array of redemptionIds to associate

params.newPricer: The address of the new pricer contract

setRedemptionFee(uint256).details: The maximum fee that can be set is 10_000 bps, or 100%

params._redemptionFee: The new redeem fee specified in basis points
